intro: Rhynchospora alta, commonly known as tall spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other similar plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in dense, spike-like clusters. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soils and is often found in prairie wetlands. Rhynchospora alta plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wetland organisms.
